importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Roberts was hired as superintendent of Des Moines Public Schools in 2023, marking the start of his tenure and the period during which the false citizenship claim was made.
Roberts was transferred to federal custody on an arrest warrant on this date, following his detention by ICE on September 26, 2025.
Roberts was detained by US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents on this date, leading to the subsequent investigation and indictment.
An appeal to reopen immigration proceedings was rejected earlier in 2025, indicating ongoing legal consequences of his immigration status.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period from 2023 to 2025 includes Roberts’ hiring, his time in office, and the subsequent legal actions and public scrutiny.

keyTakeAways: Ian Roberts, former superintendent of Des Moines Public Schools, was indicted by a federal grand jury for falsely claiming U.S. citizenship on an I-9 form and for unlawfully possessing firearms while an illegal alien.
Roberts, originally from Guyana, fled from ICE agents in a district-issued Jeep Cherokee and was later found in a wooded area with a handgun wrapped in a towel.
A federal investigation revealed that Roberts knowingly misrepresented his immigration status, leading to charges of making a false statement for employment and illegal possession of firearms.
Three additional firearms were found during a search of his home, including two pistols, a rifle, and a shotgun, increasing the severity of the charges.
An immigration judge previously issued a final removal order, and an appeal to reopen proceedings was rejected, confirming his status as an illegal alien.
Des Moines Public Schools is currently filing a lawsuit against the consulting firm involved in the 2023 superintendent search, citing concerns over improper promotion of Roberts.
Jackie Norris, school board chair, initiated a financial review of Roberts’ expenditures and ended her campaign for the U.S. Senate on the same day the indictment was reported.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Ian Roberts, the former superintendent of Des Moines Public Schools, has been indicted by a federal grand jury for falsely claiming U.S. citizenship on an I-9 form and for unlawfully possessing firearms while an illegal alien. Authorities say Roberts, originally from Guyana, fled ICE agents in September 2025 and was found with a handgun in a vehicle, with additional weapons discovered at his home. Federal immigration proceedings had previously concluded with a final removal order, and an appeal was denied. The incident has triggered a lawsuit by the school district against the consulting firm involved in the 2023 hiring process, and school board chair Jackie Norris has ended her Senate campaign amid growing public scrutiny of the hiring and financial dealings involving Roberts.
title: Iowa Superintendent Detained by ICE Falsely Claimed He Was a US Citizen, Indictment Says
